data.title: Kotkamills – official main sponsor of FC KTP “We want to support football also for juniors and women”
data.meta_description: Kotkamills, a manufacturer of fully recyclable food service board, and FC KTP have signed a broad collaboration agreement for the 2021 football season...
data.text:
Kotkamills, a manufacturer of fully recyclable food service board, and FC KTP have signed a broad collaboration agreement for the 2021 football season. The main collaboration covers the men’s and women’s teams as well as the club’s juniors.

“The key themes of the collaboration are responsibility and local welfare. We want to be a strong supporter of local events and successful sporting communities, including the physical activity of children and young people,” says Markku Hämäläinen, CEO of Kotkamills.

“The collaboration agreement with Kotkamills enables a significant increase in coaching training, for example for children of primary school and junior high school age. The club can now also make equipment purchases for those most in need,” says FC KTP’s Coaching Director Janne Hyppönen joyfully.

“The sponsorship also makes it easier for the women’s team to prepare for the season with the arrangement of physical training and rehabilitation,” says FC KTP’s Account Manager Jari-Pekka Gummerus.

At its matches and other events, FC KTP will use cups and food trays made from Kotkamills’ board. Kotkamills and FC KTP will work in close cooperation in the recycling of the used food and beverage containers.

“The goal is to convey information about eco-friendliness and responsibility, and to raise awareness about Kotkamills’ products and solutions throughout the club community and among various stakeholders. With spectators ranging in age from babies to senior citizens, the user experience with new materials and the eco-friendly and responsible recycling practices become familiar to the general public,” says Saila Kettunen, Vice President, Sustainability and Communications at Kotkamills.

Further information:

Jari-Pekka Gummerus, Account Manager, FC KTP

Tietoa julkaisijasta

About FC KTP

KTP is a traditional sports club from Kotka and was founded in 1927. Its men’s football team has celebrated the Finnish championship in 1951 and 1952 and achieved the Finnish Cup in 1958, 1961, 1967 and 1980. The club’s women’s team won bronze in 1981. KTP is one of Finland's best-known sports brands and the green-white logo is a familiar sight on the field. In the club community, there are teams that play from play school-age to women's and men's first teams. In the 2021 season, the men's first team will play in the Veikkausliiga at the highest league level in Finland and the women's first team will play in the 3rd tier. Named after the legendary KTP player, Arto Tolsa, the home field is located just a few hundred meters from the fence of the Kotkamills factory area. Teemu Pukki, KTP's brightest star home-grown player, plays for Norwich City FC and the national team of Finland.

About Kotkamills

Kotkamills, located in Finland, is an experienced and responsible global partner, manufacturing innovative products created from wood, a renewable natural resource. Our range of sustainable products includes food safe consumer boards, the high-quality saturating base kraft paper Absorbex®, and ecological wood products. The fully recyclable AEGLE® and ISLA® boards, produced since 2016, were complemented in 2018 with water-based dispersion barriers replacing plastics used in packaging and food service applications. All our products are environmentally friendly, recyclable and safe to use.
